title: The science of laughter - Sasha Winkler

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the key findings about laughter from researchers?

options.label: B
options.text: Laughter is not unique to humans, as many animals exhibit similar behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: Laughter is a result of stress.

options.label: D
options.text: Laughter is a result of boredom.

multiple-choice.question: What is thought to be the original purpose of laughter in animals?
What is one of the reasons why laughter is contagious?

options.label: C
options.text: It is a result of boredom.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a result of sadness.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the benefits of laughter for human health?
What can observers across the world and as young as 5 months old tell the difference between?

options.label: A
options.text: Close friends and acquaintances based on their facial expressions.

options.label: B
options.text: Close friends and acquaintances based on brief clips of them laughing.

options.label: C
options.text: Close friends and acquaintances based on their voice.

options.label: D
options.text: Close friends and acquaintances based on their body language.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the differences between real and fake laughter?

options.label: A
options.text: Real laughter is louder than fake laughter.

options.label: B
options.text: Real laughter is produced in different networks in the brain than fake laughter.

options.label: C
options.text: Real laughter is a result of stress.

options.label: D
options.text: Real laughter is a result of boredom.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the universal characteristics of laughter in humans?

options.label: B
options.text: It is a result of stress.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a result of boredom.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a universal human behavior.

multiple-choice.question: What can be triggered by hearing clips of laughter?
What is one of the benefits of laughter for social bonding?

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on social bonding.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a result of stress.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the reasons why people can tell whether a laugh is real or fake?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a result of stress.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a result of boredom.

options.label: C
options.text: It is based on the sound of the laugh.

options.label: D
options.text: It is based on the facial expression of the person laughing.

title: Does planting trees actually cool the planet? - Carolyn Beans

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason for the failure of Chile's tree planting effort between 1974 and 2012?

options.label: B
options.text: Wrong species of trees were planted

options.label: C
options.text: Focus on afforestation rather than reforestation

options.label: D
options.text: Climate change was not a pressing issue at the time

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between afforestation and reforestation?

options.label: A
options.text: Afforestation involves planting trees in urban areas, while reforestation involves planting trees in rural areas

options.label: B
options.text: Afforestation involves planting trees in places long devoid of forests, while reforestation involves restoring recently degraded forests

options.label: C
options.text: Afforestation involves planting non-native trees, while reforestation involves planting native trees

options.label: D
options.text: Afforestation involves planting trees in drylands, while reforestation involves planting trees in snowy terrain

multiple-choice.question: Why are plantation trees often harvested?

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are not as effective at carbon storage as natural forests

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are not as profitable as native trees

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated area needed to match the tree planting goals set by four of the largest oil and gas producers?

options.label: D
options.text: Land twice the size of the UK

multiple-choice.question: Why is it bad to plant trees in drylands or snowy terrain?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it can lead to deforestation

options.label: B
options.text: Because it can lead to a warmer planet

options.label: C
options.text: Because it can lead to a decrease in biodiversity

options.label: D
options.text: Because it can lead to an increase in carbon emissions

multiple-choice.question: What is a more efficient way to re-green the planet?

options.label: A
options.text: By planting trees in large quantities

options.label: B
options.text: By protecting forests and letting nature regenerate on its own

options.label: C
options.text: By using technology to absorb carbon dioxide

options.label: D
options.text: By using biofuels to power vehicles

multiple-choice.question: Why is it bad to use tree planting as a catch-all solution?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it can lead to deforestation

options.label: B
options.text: Because it can lead to a decrease in biodiversity

options.label: C
options.text: Because it can distract from more complex issues like carbon emissions and active deforestation

options.label: D
options.text: Because it can lead to an increase in carbon emissions

multiple-choice.question: What is greenwashing?

options.label: A
options.text: The practice of using tree planting to offset emissions

options.label: B
options.text: The practice of using technology to absorb carbon dioxide

options.label: C
options.text: The practice of using biofuels to power vehicles

options.label: D
options.text: The practice of throwing money at initiatives that have no real chance of achieving the carbon offsets they promise

multiple-choice.question: Why is it essential to consider which species to plant, which lands to forest, and how to protect the land long-term?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it can lead to deforestation

options.label: B
options.text: Because it can lead to a decrease in biodiversity

options.label: C
options.text: Because it can have negative consequences if done incorrectly

options.label: D
options.text: Because it can lead to an increase in carbon emissions

multiple-choice.question: What is the best investment in a greener future?

options.label: B
options.text: Protecting forests and letting nature regenerate on its own

options.label: C
options.text: Using technology to absorb carbon dioxide

options.label: D
options.text: Cutting carbon emissions and protecting forests from being destroyed

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why sperm whales in the North Pacific began to adapt to the presence of whaling ships in the mid-1800s?

options.label: A
options.text: They formed defensive circles at the surface to avoid whaling.

options.label: B
options.text: They used fast currents to escape whaling boats.

options.label: C
options.text: They changed their behavior to avoid human attacks.

options.label: D
options.text: They developed a new communication method to alert other whales.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the spermaceti organ in a sperm whale's head?

options.label: C
options.text: To fill a cavity in the sperm whale's head.

options.label: D
options.text: To generate a powerful, focused beam.

options.label: D
